utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Ooo. Oh. Woah.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooo, that was…

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Oh yeah. Top ten at least.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But… maybe top twenty.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Not top ten?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, there was Paris. Hawaii, Yankee Stadium.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Oh, that place in the Poconos.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Beacon Heights. Coney Island.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And then there was Staten Island.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Oh, and the hot air balloon.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Westminster Dog Show.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Oh…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was…

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: That’s only nine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, the night we made Alexis.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: We have had fun, haven’t we?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh yeah.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Makes you wonder why we ever got divorced.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know, right? I mean, except for you having an affair with your director, moving to Malibu and serving me with divorce papers. I think we really had a chance.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: I’m moving back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Back to New York?

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: I miss it. I miss it, I miss Alexis, I miss you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Um, what about your career?

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Oh, LA’s changed. The juicy roles just aren’t there for an actress of my calibre. I need a change, like Broadway maybe? The legitimate stage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah well… ah… woah… time out… hold on, have you really thought this through?

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: What’s to think about? You, me, Alexis, all living in the same city. It’s going to be just like old times.

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Vic’s an African-American male, early twenties, multiple stab wounds, contusions on the arms and torso. Body was discovered by a homeless guy.

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: He was beaten, maybe tortured.

utterance.speaker: DETECTIVE KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like some kind of ritualistic killing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You think? Hello.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You OK?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I had sex with my ex-wife this morning. My first ex-wife, Meredith. Alexis’s mom, and she’s thinking about moving back to New York. Do you know what that would mean to me? That would be a very special brand of hell, the hell of a deep-fried Twinkie.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A deep-fried Twinkie?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, the guilty pleasure that you know is bad for you? So you only do it once, maybe twice a year for the novelty, but a deep-fried Twinkie every day is aghh…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Crime scene, dead body. A little respect here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don’t think he can hear me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: OK, how about a little self-respect then?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fine. Check in his mouth, there is probably a little pouch in there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did you know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Open it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What does it mean?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s Voudou.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Voudou? What’s that, some kind of Star Trek thing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No dude, it’s a religion practiced primarily in West Africa. What? I read too.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The blood in the bowl -- most likely animal, part of the ceremony. The pouch is an offering to the spirits, but I don’t recognise the symbol.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If you did, you’d be a suspect. So how do you know about all this?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Research for my sixth Derrick Storm novel.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Unholy Storm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, thank you. And Voudou is not just limited to West Africa, it’s also practices by Haitian and Dominican communities right here in New York.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Have CSU run the pouch, have an ME test the blood, and let's get his fingerprints in the system, see if there’s an ID. This ritual -- I suppose it was done for a specific purpose?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s only if you are assuming that the guy doing this was rational.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no, she’s right. It might not make sense to you or me but ah… If we found out why he did this we might find your killer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s kind of how we do it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you still have the research?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: As a matter of fact, I do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: "The purpose of the rituals was to make contact with the spirits and the spirit world, to gain their favour through sacrifice. Storm was pretty sure he’d sacrifice anything when he saw the amulet swaying back and forth between the woman’s bare glistening breasts."

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Unholy Storm. You dragged me in here so you could read from your own book?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey, there’s a lot of good stuff in here - some of it is factual. Where are you going?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I have a murder to solve.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I thought that’s what we were doing? OK, look… I am just kidding. I do have another source.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You call your ex-wife a deep-fried Twinkie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, trust me. As annoying and intrusive as you think I am, she’s a million times worse.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about Alexis? Maybe she missed her mom, maybe it’d be a good idea to have her back in town.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, right. This once when Alexis was nine, Meredith dropped by to take her out to lunch.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: In Paris. Paris, and then she acted like there was nothing wrong, like Auntie Mame on meth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If she’s so bad, then why did you sleep with her this morning?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let me tell you something about crazy people. The sex is unbelievable.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How shallow are you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Very.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, I don’t have time for this.

utterance.speaker: MICHELLE
utterance.content: Someone order lunch?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, meet my other source.

utterance.speaker: MICHELLE
utterance.content: The symbols are Vévé, a representation of one who can open cross roads in to the spirit world.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Michelle taught me everything I know about Voudou.

utterance.speaker: MICHELLE
utterance.content: Which obviously isn’t much. That scene with the topless girl and the chicken blood, what was that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I took a few liberties.

utterance.speaker: MICHELLE
utterance.content: You know, from the design, I’d say this isn’t Haitian, Jamaican, or Dominican; this is hard-core Nigerian.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about this charm?

utterance.speaker: MICHELLE
utterance.content: The charm's an offering to a Voudou saint or loa; in this case it’s Ogun. He’s usually called up to find something that is lost.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So our killer’s looking for something.

utterance.speaker: MICHELLE
utterance.content: Something the victim once possessed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe that’s why he was tortured? Could the kind of ceremony indicate what the killer was looking for?

utterance.speaker: MICHELLE
utterance.content: Unfortunately, no.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do you know so much about this?

utterance.speaker: MICHELLE
utterance.content: Because I practice. My junior year I spent abroad in Nigeria. Fell in love with the religion, the cuisine--

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Michelle owns the best Nigerian restaurant in the city.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s funny, I never would have pegged you for the occult type.

utterance.speaker: MICHELLE
utterance.content: Occult is in the eye of the beholder, Detective. As bizarre as Voudou may seem to you, I assure you the beliefs of western religions seem just as strange to outsiders. How do you like the cow’s foot stew?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cow’s foot. You said it was beef.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Technically cow is beef. Besides, you liked it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, this murder - is that a part of the ceremony as well?

utterance.speaker: MICHELLE
utterance.content: No. Voudou is a peaceful, deeply spiritual religion practiced by millions of people across the world every day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I doubt whoever did this is very peaceful.

utterance.speaker: MICHELLE
utterance.content: No. Your killer may be voudoun, but that’s not why this man’s dead. He was killed because he has something the killer desperately wants. And he’s not going to stop until he finds it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me. Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s Ryan. We got another one.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Victim’s name is Darcy Cho. Second-year lawyer at a firm downtown.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Multiple stab wounds, just like the last one.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Neighbour found the door open and called the super. This is what they found.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Staging is exactly the same.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. When they saw what they had, West Side boys gave us a call.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looks like she put up a fight: defensive wounds on her forearm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Paraphernalia is the same as the other murder, and found another charm in her mouth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Anything back from CSU on the other scene?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Candle’s basic paraffin, found in any bodega. Figured it was going to be the same with this one. Cloth is common red flannel; glass bowl made in China.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What about the blood?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Chicken blood.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe she used this purse to defend herself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We know he hasn’t found what he’s looking for.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The charm in her mouth, still needs the spirits to guide him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Chapter ten.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Find out what you can about Darcy, see if she knew our first victim. I wanna know how these murders are connected.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS CASTLE
utterance.content: Mr Simmons, you wanted to see me?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What? No, is it my dad? did he get shot?

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: It’s not your dad, sweetie.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Mom.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: It’s your grandfather. He passed away this morning.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Grandfather.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: I know it’s a lot to take in.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Mom, I have a calculus test today.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Thank you, Mr. Simmons, for your compassion in this trying time. Let's go, honey, lots to do.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Ah Mom, Grandpa died six years ago.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Yeah, I know but a death in the family -- always a good excuse to get off school.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: No, it’s a creepy excuse.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Come on. I need some Alexis time. Do you realise I’ve been in town a whole week and we haven’t even gone shopping?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We’re going shopping on Saturday - when I don’t have school.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: But Beddles is having a sale now.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I’ve studied all week for this test.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: OK, why bother learning math if you don’t get to apply it in real life learning situations like -- calculating your savings? Come on, what’s the harm? Unless you really want to go back and tell Mr Simmons your mother’s a liar?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Fine, but promise we’re not leaving the city.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Come on.

utterance.speaker: JILL BUTTON
utterance.content: It doesn’t make sense. Why would someone kill her?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ms Button, your office manager said that you and Darcy were close?

utterance.speaker: JILL
utterance.content: We joined the firm at the same time, neither of us knew anyone in the city so we just sort of became best friends.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do you recognise this man? We think he and Darcy might be connected.

utterance.speaker: JILL
utterance.content: No, I don’t. What happened to him?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s what we’re trying to find out.

utterance.speaker: JILL
utterance.content: Oh, God, you mean this is what happened… Who would do something like this?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I spoke to Jill Button, Darcy’s BFF. She said she’s pretty familiar with all of Darcy’s friends and clients, but she’s never seen the vic before. Law firm does some corporate stuff, some immigration work, but there is nothing to indicate any involvement in something like this.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: So our first victim gets killed in a religious ritual, and then history repeats itself with his lawyer the very same day.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, there’s a lawyer joke there somewhere. I just can’t think of it.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: And then the killer tossed the woman’s apartment looking for what? Money, drugs, what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: As far as we could tell, Darcy was clean.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. We got a hit on the first victim's prints. INS database.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Jamal Buoncy.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nigerian national, entered the US on a student visa eighteen months ago. Was enrolled at NYU as an exchange student.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: His visa expired a year ago.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yep.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like he decided to stay.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Lucky him.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Any word on his last known whereabouts?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I was able to track down the family he lived with when he was a student. Last time they saw him, he was in a cab on his way to Kennedy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I take it that’s not the end of the story.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Turns out that Jamal and their thirteen-year-old son were pretty close. A couple of months ago, the folks discovered that they were still in touch. Jamal’s cell phone number billed to an address on East Third.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s just a few blocks from where Jamal’s body was found.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: East Third is right near Darcy Cho’s law firm.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: And you said Darcy Cho’s firm did some work on immigration?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: You and Esposito take a ride down there, and I want you to look at Darcy Cho’s client list. Maybe Jamal used another name.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’ll get a warrant for the billing address.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Find out what this guy wants before this son of a ***** kills again, all right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes sir.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wasn’t expecting a doorman building, but a six-story walk-up?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You should have seen my first apartment. Three flights up on an airshaft over a restaurant, whole place smelled like chicken wings.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: They come here looking for a new start and this is what they get, slum housing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Still, for some it’s better than what they left.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sounds like Jamal didn’t live alone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, NYPD, no. Hands, show me your hands.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m not immigration, everybody just relax, OK.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m a homicide detective. I’m looking for information on Jamal Buoncy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then you want to tell my why his cell phone is billed to this address?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Detective. Same red flannel. Ooo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What is it? Whose bed is that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We can link the red flannel to two other murders in this country; that puts you in a lot of trouble.

utterance.speaker: AZI
utterance.content: I’ve done nothing wrong.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Two people are dead; one of them is a man that you lived with. Same red flannel, same candles, and again here. Why did you kill her, Azi?

utterance.speaker: AZI
utterance.content: I don’t know this woman. I haven’t killed anyone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So your telling me that it’s all just a coincidence that these things were found in your apartment under your bed?

utterance.speaker: AZI
utterance.content: They weren’t mine. They were for someone else.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who? Do you want to go back to Nigeria? Because I can arrange that with a single phone call.

utterance.speaker: AZI
utterance.content: So can he.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who? Jamal was your friend, wasn’t he?

utterance.speaker: AZI
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then don’t you want us to catch who killed him? Don’t you want justice?

utterance.speaker: AZI
utterance.content: His name is Charles, Charles Oni.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Charles Oni.

utterance.speaker: AZI
utterance.content: Immigrants know this man. He owns the places where we live, he owns the places where we work.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what about Jamal? Did he work for him too?

utterance.speaker: AZI
utterance.content: At his store on Canal Street. But it was only temporary. He was going to save his money to apply for a visa, become legal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And Oni had a problem with that?

utterance.speaker: AZI
utterance.content: No. Yesterday, when Oni came looking for Jamal, he said Jamal had taken something. But Jamal was not said thief but Oni insisted. He say he knew my father was the priest of our village, so he made to show him how to invoke the spirits.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What did Jamal take?

utterance.speaker: AZI
utterance.content: Oni didn’t say.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why didn’t you ask?

utterance.speaker: AZI
utterance.content: Cause I was scared. Because he would have killed me. The only reason I am telling you this now is because Jamal was a friend. He did not deserve to die like that. Oni was wrong.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: City records show no vendor's licence for Charles Oni on Canal Street.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, the guy's exploiting illegals. I doubt he’s going to use his own name.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Clearly not; the apartment is owned by a Robert Burnett. No listing in the Tri State area and the address is a PO box in Jersey.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo yo. Law firm’s a dead end; they’ve never heard of anyone named Jamal Buoncy. And there was nothing suspicious in Darcy’s client list.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s perfect, because our suspect has never heard of Darcy Cho. We still have no idea what our two victims have in common.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: No, I’m not going to wait downstairs. Do you have any idea who pays your salary? Me and my taxes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that - ?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, yep.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Richard! Over here!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Deep-fried Twinkie?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Afraid so. Meredith, what a surprise.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: I know, isn’t it great? In LA no one ever just stops by. Don’t you just love this town?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: More and more by the minute.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, Meredith, these are Detectives Ryan, Esposito, and Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Oh, Beckett, your new muse. Alexis told me all about it. And I simply had to stop by. You know I was his inspiration once?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Were you now?

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Still am, from time to time. Right, Kitten?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I had this dream once, only I was naked and far less embarrassed.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Anyway, we were in the neighbourhood and I have a dinner tonight, so I thought I’d drop Alexis here instead of schlepping all the way downtown. Is that SJP’s purse?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: SJP?

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Sarah Jessica Parker. She wore one just like it to the Armani show on the lawn, it was on Fashion Scoop Daily last week.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, actually this purse belongs to one of our victims.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Oh, that is so tragic. More tragic of course if it had been the real thing, but still.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Are you saying this one is fake?

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Well, look at the leather and the stitching; it’s totally a knock off. I mean, it’s good enough to fool the untrained shopper, but I have a retail eye.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Canal Street.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Canal is where they sell all the knock-off watches, luggage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And handbags.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Darcy’s office is right near Canal. If she was going to buy a designer knock-off --

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She might have got it on the stall where Jamal works.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oni’s stall. That’s what connects our two victims. Get a sketch from Azi; maybe one of the other vendors will be able to ID Oni’s stall.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You got it, boss.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: See, I always was your lucky charm. Just think of the things we’ll do once I move back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ha ha ha ha.

utterance.speaker: AZI
utterance.content: That’s Oni. That’s Oni.

utterance.speaker: RYAN

utterance.content: Your last gun battle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t be so pessimistic. I think I handled myself pretty well.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, probably saved my life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Probably? I definitely saved your life, and you know what that means, don’t you? It means you owe me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Owe you what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whatever I want. And you know exactly what I want, don’t you? You know what I really, really want you to do... ? Never, ever call me 'Kitten.'

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, sweetie?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hypothetically, is it OK to love someone but not want them around all the time?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You mean Mom?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I love her, I do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know you do, and I’m glad you do.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But, Dad, she drives me crazy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s what moms do.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: But if she lives here....

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Richard. Richard, Alexis.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your secret’s safe with me.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Hello, anyone home? Hello. You will not believe what happened. I got a call from my agent. I’ve been offered a huge role in a new indie film.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Wow. Mom, that’s awesome.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: It is, but. ...Here’s the bad news, sweetie. I’m going to have to put my plans to move back to New York on hold.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, however will we manage?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, that’s OK, Mom. It sounds like a huge opportunity.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: It is, it really is. Besides, it’s not like Broadway’s going anywhere. I can always do theatre when I’m too old for hi-def.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: So when do you need to be back in LA?

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Tomorrow. I need to get back to my hotel and pack, but I wanted to tell you the good news. There’s so much fun stuff we didn’t get to do. But I’ll be back soon, I promise.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I know. I love you, Mom, thanks for taking me shopping.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Oh, anytime. Goodbye, Martha.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Meredith.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know I always hate to see you go.

utterance.speaker: MEREDITH
utterance.content: Next time, top ten.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Top ten.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: OK, Dad, spill.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What did you do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing. Oh, my business manager called with an excellent investment opportunity. A small artsy independent feature.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, that’s my boy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s perfect for the role, I’m doing them a favor. I think. I hope you don’t mind.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Raising one parent’s hard enough, I don’t know what I’d do if I had to raise two.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: There wasn’t a little part for me in the artsy…?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh ah no.
